Politics.title: **BREAKING: Kim Jong-un Unveils New Economic Plan: "Glorious Pizza for All"**
Politics.content:
**BREAKING: Kim Jong-un Unveils New Economic Plan: "Glorious Pizza for All"**

Pyongyang, North Korea - In a surprise move, Supreme Leader Kim Jong-un announced a radical new economic strategy to boost the country's sluggish economy. Dubbed "GFA" (Glorious Glory Food Agenda), the plan aims to make North Korea the world's largest producer of artisanal, gluten-free, vegan pizzas. "It's a culinary revolution!" exclaimed the rotund leader, sporting a new haircut that eerily resembled a pizza crust. "Our glorious nation will soon export the finest, most magnificent pizzas to the world, and everyone will bow down to our saucy greatness!"

According to sources close to the Supreme Leader, the "GGFA" plan will create millions of new jobs, primarily in the fields of dough-kneading, and pizza-topping innovation. "It's a masterstroke," gushed Pyongyang's Minister of Propaganda, "Kim Jong-un is a genius! Who needs nuclear missiles when you have the power of perfectly melted mozzarella?" Insiders reveal that the Supreme Leader has already begun testing pizza recipes in secret underground bunkers, with results described as "mixed" to " marginally inedible." Undeterred, Kim Jong-un has pledged to share his creation with the world, threatening to launch a "Gastronomic Great Leap Forward" unless the international community acknowledges North Korea's pizza supremacy.

Politics.title: **BREAKING: Vladimir Putin Announces Plan to Solve World Hunger by Feeding Hungry People to His Pet Bear**
Politics.content:
**BREAKING: Vladimir Putin Announces Plan to Solve World Hunger by Feeding Hungry People to His Pet Bear**

In a shocking press conference at the Kremlin, Russian President Vladimir Putin unveiled his latest plan to solve world hunger, and it's a doozy. According to sources, Putin has been feeding his pet bear, Rasputin, a steady diet of caviar and borscht, and the bear has gotten a little too comfortable. "I realized, why not use Rasputin's insatiable appetite to solve the hunger crisis?" Putin exclaimed. "It's a win-win! The hungry people get a free meal, and Rasputin gets a never-ending buffet of human snacks." When asked about the ethics of feeding humans to a bear, Putin shrugged, "Hey, it's not like I'm the first world leader to use humans as food for my pets. Ask Henry VIII about his pet lions.**

The plan, dubbed "Hunger-B-Gone," has already gained traction among Putin's closest allies, including Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko, who has offered to provide a fleet of refrigerated trucks to transport the hungry masses to the Kremlin. "It's a small price to pay for the opportunity to dine on the finest human cuisine," Lukashenko said in a statement. The United Nations has yet to comment on the plan, but sources close to the organization say they are "utterly horrified" and "seriously considering relocating to a

Politics.title: **BREAKING NEWS**
Politics.content:
**BREAKING NEWS**

In a shocking turn of events, Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez has declared himself "Emperor of the World" and has demanded that all nations surrender their sovereignty to Madrid. According to sources close to the PM, Sánchez was inspired by a late-night Netflix binge of "Narcos" and has since become convinced that he is the reincarnation of Pablo Escobar. "Viva la España!" Sánchez was heard shouting in the halls of the Moncloa Palace, as he donned a sequined jumpsuit and ordered his aides to fetch him a bowl of gazpacho.

As news of Sánchez's declaration spread, world leaders scrambled to respond. German Chancellor Angela Merkel was overheard muttering "not again" as she rolled her eyes and dispatched a team of diplomats to Madrid to try and talk Sánchez down from his imperial high horse. Meanwhile, US President Joe Biden was seen frantically googling "What is Spain?" as he struggled to come up with a coherent response. Russian President Vladimir Putin, meanwhile, simply shrugged and said "Hey, as long as he doesn't try to annex Siberia, I'm good."

As the international community teeters on the brink of chaos, Sánchez has announced plans to hold a lavish coronation ceremony in Madrid's Royal Palace, featuring a performance by Shakira and a buffet of paella and tapas. World leaders are invited to attend, but are warned that anyone who fails to bring a gift

Politics.title: **BREAKING: Kim Jong-Un Unveils New "Democratic" Hairdo, Claims Nobel Peace Prize**
Politics.content:
**BREAKING: Kim Jong-Un Unveils New "Democratic" Hairdo, Claims Nobel Peace Prize**

Pyongyang, North Korea - In a shocking turn of events, Supreme Leader Kim Jong-Un has unveiled a bold new hairstyle that he claims is the key to world peace and democracy." The new 'do, which features a towering pompadour and what appears to be a small bird's nest nestled in the curls, has been hailed as a "masterstroke of diplomacy" by the North Korean state media. According to sources close to the regime, Kim spent hours in front of the mirror perfecting the look, insisting that it is "the embodiment of freedom and prosperity for the people of North Korea."

In a surprise press conference, Kim claimed that his new hairstyle has already brought about a "new era of cooperation" between North Korea and the international community. "The West is finally recognizing the genius of my leadership, and it's all thanks to this magnificent hair," Kim declared, stroking his towering pompadour. "I mean, who needs human rights and free elections when you have a hairdo that's this majestic?" The United Nations has already announced plans to award Kim the Nobel Peace Prize, citing his "innovative approach to global harmony through follicular diplomacy."

Politics.title: **BREAKING: Kim Jong-un Unveils New Economic Plan: "Glory to the Leader, Glory to the Donuts"**
Politics.content:
**BREAKING: Kim Jong-un Unveils New Economic Plan: "Glory to the Leader, Glory to the Donuts"**

Pyongyang, North Korea - In a surprise move, Supreme Leader Kim Jong-un announced a bold new economic plan aimed at lifting the nation out of poverty and into the annals of greatness. The plan, "Glory to the Leader, Glory to the Donuts," promises to make North Korea the world's largest producer of artisanal pastry by 2025. According to sources, the plan involves mobilizing the nation's collective might to bake, glaze, and sprinkle an endless supply of donuts, which will then be exported to eager customers worldwide. "It's a win-win," declared Kim, resplendent in his signature jumpsuit. "The people will be fed, the economy will boom, and I will finally have a decent snack to munch on during long-range missile tests."

Details of the plan remain sketchy, but it's rumored that a special Donut Ministry will be established, staffed by the nation's most loyal and skilled bakers. Insiders claim that a special "Donut-ometric" system will be introduced, where citizens will be measured by the number of donuts produced, rather than the traditional GDP. Aliens.title: **GALACTIC GAZETTE EXCLUSIVE**
Aliens.content:
**GALACTIC GAZETTE EXCLUSIVE**

In a shocking turn of events, Earth's top astronomers have confirmed that aliens have been secretly inhabiting our moon, and they're not exactly thrilled about our Netflix subscription. According to sources, the extraterrestrial beings, known as the "Lunar Lizards," have been monitoring our binge-watching habits and are appalled by our lack of taste in original content. "We were promised a galaxy of infinite possibilities, but all we got was 10 seasons of 'The Office' reruns," said Zorvath, the Lunar Lizards' leader, in a statement. "We're considering revoking Earth's intergalactic internet privileges unless we see some real effort put into producing quality content."

Meanwhile, in a bizarre incident, a group of aliens from the planet Zorgon were spotted participating in a rave party in rural Nebraska. The extraterrestrial ravers, clad in neon-green jumpsuits, were reportedly getting down to an epic set of electronic dance music, courtesy of a DJ from the planet Glint. "We just wanted to experience the quintessential Earth experience – getting weird in the Midwest," said an alien partygoer, sipping on a cosmically-enhanced energy drink. "Who knew that 'YMCA' by the Village People would be the universal language of partying?" As the intergalactic rave continued into the early hours of the morning, local authorities were left scratching their heads," wondering

Aliens.title: **GALACTIC TIMES NETWORK**
Aliens.content:
**GALACTIC TIMES NETWORK**

**DATE: 3/30/2023**

In a shocking turn of events, the Galactic Union of Advanced Life Forms (GUALF) has officially declared Earth as the "Most Entertaining Planet in the Milky Way" and has scheduled a galaxy-wide "Intergalactic Reality TV Show" to be broadcast live from the planet's moon. According to sources, the show will feature a mix of "bizarre human rituals" such as the "Daily Morning Commute" and "Reality TV Show Marathons" which have been deemed "hilariously entertaining" by the alien community. The show is expected to attract a record-breaking audience of 10 billion extraterrestrial viewers, with many placing bets on which human contestant will be the first to "spill coffee on themselves" during rush hour.

Meanwhile, the United Nations has issued a statement urging humans to "keep it weird" and to "try too hard" to impress the alien audience. A spokesperson for the UN added, "We're not sure what kind of ratings the aliens are looking for, but we're pretty sure they're not looking for humans doing actual productive work." In response, several major corporations have already launched "Alien-Friendly" product lines, including a new line of "Glittery Space Toiletries" and "Inflatable Alien Costume Onesies." Aliens.title: **BREAKING: Aliens Abduct World's Supply of Avocado Toast, Demand Better Brunch Options**
Aliens.content:
**BREAKING: Aliens Abduct World's Supply of Avocado Toast, Demand Better Brunch Options**

In a shocking turn of events, Earth's alien overlords have absconded with the planet's entire stash of artisanal avocado toast, leaving hipsters and brunch enthusiasts reeling. The extraterrestrial thieves, identified as the "Zlorgs," claim they're sick of the galaxy's subpar breakfast options and are holding humanity's avocado toast for ransom. We've had it with the same old boring breakfast buffet," said Zlorg leader, Zorblort, in a statement. "We want to see some real innovation – maybe some quinoa-stuffed French toast or a good old-fashioned eggs benedict with a side of galaxy-grade hollandaise."

As the world struggles to come to terms with this intergalactic brunch crisis, reports are emerging of bizarre alien antics on Earth. In Tokyo, a giant, glowing squid-like creature was spotted playing the piano at a trendy coffee shop, while in New York City, a group of aliens were seen attempting to break the world record for most selfies taken with a confused-looking cat. When asked to comment on the Zlorgs' demands, the United Nations Secretary-General shrugged, saying, "Honestly, we're just trying to figure out how to get them to return our avocado toast without having to agree to their demands for a galaxy-wide 'Taco Tuesday' observatories around the world have detected strange energy signals

Aliens.title: **GALACTIC SHOCKER**
Aliens.content:
**GALACTIC SHOCKER**

In a bizarre turn of events, the United Nations has announced that aliens from the planet Zorgon have officially taken over the world's supply of avocado toast. According to sources, the Zorgonians have been secretly infiltrating popular brunch spots and replacing the beloved breakfast staple with a strange, glowing substance that has been deemed "highly addictive and mildly toxic." The UN has issued a statement urging citizens to remain calm and to "just, like, try the quinoa bowl instead or something."

As the world grapples with the great avocado heist, reports are emerging of aliens from the planet Glintzenburg engaging in a series of bizarre pranks on unsuspecting humans. In one incident, a group of Glintzenburgians allegedly replaced the world's largest disco ball with a giant, spinning pineapple, causing widespread confusion and spontaneous outbreaks of choreographed dance routines. Meanwhile, authorities are still trying to make sense of the strange, glowing crop circles that have begun appearing in rural areas, which appear to be part of an intergalactic game of "alien Pictionary." When asked for comment, a Glintzenburgian official" simply shrugged and said, "Hey, we're trying to get our extraterrestrial feet wet, okay?"

Aliens.title: **BREAKING:** Aliens from Planet Zorgon Disguise Themselves as Midwesterners, Demand More Corn
Aliens.content:
**BREAKING:** Aliens from Planet Zorgon Disguise Themselves as Midwesterners, Demand More Corn

In a bizarre turn of events, extraterrestrial beings from the planet Zorgon have infiltrated the heartland of America, blending in seamlessly with the locals. Disguising themselves as Midwesterners, the aliens have been spotted at local farmer's markets, loudly complaining about the price of corn. "I'm tellin' ya, Mabel, this is highway robbery!" said Zor-Veen, a Zorgon masquerading as a Nebraska farmer. "I need this corn for my intergalactic spaceship's fuel injector, and I ain't got all day to haggle!" The aliens' affinity for corn has led to a surge in demand, sending corn prices skyrocketing.

As the Zorgons continue to blend in, they've taken to other peculiar human habits. They've been spotted binge-watching Netflix shows, arguing over the best" pizza topping, and even participating in line dancing competitions. "I never thought I'd see the day where an extraterrestrial being would out-twang me on the dance floor," said local line dancer, Bubbles McGee. "But that Zor-Veen's got moves like Jagger!" The aliens' fascination with human culture has led to the formation of an intergalactic fan club, dedicated to spreading the gospel of Dolly Parton's music throughout the cosmos.

Education.title: **BREAKING: Harvard University Announces New Major in Procrastination, Applications Soar**
Education.content:
**BREAKING: Harvard University Announces New Major in Procrastination, Applications Soar**

Cambridge, MA - In a bold move to stay ahead of the curve, Harvard University has introduced a brand new major in Procrastination Studies, and applications are pouring in from around the world. "Art of Doing Nothing" majors, as they're affectionately called, will spend four years mastering the skills of binge-watching Netflix, playing video games, and perfecting the art of staring blankly into space. "We're thrilled to offer this innovative program," said Dr. Jane Smith, Dean of Undergraduate Studies. "Our research shows that the most successful individuals in today's society are, in fact, expert procrastinators."

The Procrastination Studies curriculum will feature core courses such as "The History of Napping," "Effective Social Media Scroll-ology," and "Advanced Techniques in Snack Food Preparation." Electives will include "The Art of Making Excuses," "Procrastination in the Workplace: A Guide," and "The Psychology of Putting Off Until Tomorrow What was Once a Badge of Shame is Now a Badge of Honor," boasted Dr. Smith. "Our graduates will be the most sought-after employees in the job market, guaranteed to get nothing done on time." Current Harvard students are already clamoring to switch majors, with many reporting a sudden and intense interest in Procrastination Studies.

In related news, Harvard has also announced a new partnership with popular gaming platform,

Education.title: **BREAKING: Harvard University Announces Groundbreaking Initiative to Make Students Even More Entitled**
Education.content:
**BREAKING: Harvard University Announces Groundbreaking Initiative to Make Students Even More Entitled**

In a bold move to further cement its reputation as a bastion of elitist snobbery, Harvard announced yesterday that it is launching a new program to make its students even more entitled than they already are. Dubbed "Project Ego-Inflation," the program will provide each student with a personalized "Entitlement Coach" who will work with them to develop their sense of superiority and self-righteousness. According to sources, students will be required to attend regular workshops on "The Art of Complaining," "Effective Eye-Rolling Techniques," and "Advanced Self-Importance Strategies."

When asked for comment, Harvard's Dean of Students, Dr. Reginald P. Bottomsworth III, said, "We're thrilled to be taking the lead in shaping the next generation of entitled leaders who will undoubtedly change the world... or at least expect the world to change for them." He added, "We believe that by empowering our students with an even greater sense of entitlement, they will be better equipped to tackle the challenges of the 21st century, like getting their parents to pay for their apartments, and getting an A in a class they didn't attend."

Reactions from students have been overwhelmingly positive, with many taking to social media to express their gratitude for the program. "I was already pretty sure I was the smartest person in the room, but now I'll have the

Education.title: **Breaking News**
Education.content:
**Breaking News**

Harvard University, the esteemed institution of higher learning, has taken the bold step of outsourcing its entire curriculum to a team of highly trained hamsters. In a move that has left academia reeling, the university's administration has confirmed that the tiny creatures will be responsible for designing and teaching courses in subjects ranging from quantum physics to 19th-century literature. According to sources, the hamsters were chosen for their impressive ability to stuff their cheeks with an impressive amount of information, as well as their extensive experience in running on wheels.

When asked about the decision, Harvard's Dean of Academic Affairs, Dr. Jane Smith, explained that the hamsters' unique skillset would "bring a fresh perspective to the field of education." She added, "Who better to teach our students about the nuances of postmodernism than a rodent who has spent its entire life running in circles?" The move is seen as a cost-cutting measure, as the hamsters will be paid in sunflower seeds and will not require health insurance. Meanwhile, students are reportedly thrilled at the prospect of being taught by creatures who are "so cute and fluffy."

In related news, Stanford University has announced that it will be replacing its faculty with a team of trained seals, while MIT has confirmed that it will be outsourcing its research to a group of particularly clever octopuses. Education.title: **Breaking News**
Education.content:
**Breaking News**

In a shocking turn of events, Harvard University, the esteemed institution of higher learning, has announced that it will now be offering a degree in "Napping and Procrastination." According to sources, the new major was created in response to the growing demand for students who are experts in doing absolutely nothing. "We're thrilled to offer this new degree," said Harvard Dean, Dr. Jane Smith. "Our students will now have the opportunity to hone their skills in the art of doing nothing, and we're confident that they will go on to do great things... eventually."

The new degree program, which includes courses such as "Advanced Couch Surfing" and "The Art of Binge-Watching," has been met with widespread criticism from parents and educators alike. "This is a travesty," said one outraged parent. "I'm paying tens of thousands of dollars for my child to learn how to sleep in till noon and play video games all day?" Despite the backlash, Harvard officials remain committed to the new degree, insisting that it will prepare students for the increasingly competitive job market of doing nothing."

In related news, Harvard has also announced that it will be partnering with popular online platform, Netflix, to offer a new "Binge-Watching and Analysis" minor. Education.title: **BREAKING: Harvard University Announces New Major in Procrastination**
Education.content:
**BREAKING: Harvard University Announces New Major in Procrastination**

Cambridge, MA - In a bold move to stay ahead of the curve, Harvard University has announced a new undergraduate major in Procrastination, citing "overwhelming demand" from students. The program, set to launch in the fall, promises to equip students with the skills they need to excel in the art of doing absolutely nothing. "We're thrilled to offer this innovative major," said Dr. Jane Smith, Chair of the Procrastination Department. "Our students will learn the techniques of expert-level procrastination, from crafting the perfect Netflix binge-watching schedule to mastering the art of staring blankly at a wall for hours on end."

According to sources, the major will require students to complete a minimum of 40 hours of video game marathons, 30 hours of social media scrolling, and 20 hours of staring out the window contemplating the meaning of life. Electives will include "The Art of Making Excuses," "Advanced Napping Techniques," and "The History of Procrastination from Ancient Greece to Modern-Day YouTube." Harvard officials claim that graduates of the program will be highly sought after by top employers, including Netflix, video game developers, and mom's basement.
